Description: Floor sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; rim broken off; white slip; exterior, grooved underside with glaze bands over grooved parts; interior: at join with rim black band with added red and white bands; frieze with black-figure decoration: horse and rider to left (head and most of forelegs of horse lost; red on neck; collar (?) decorated with alternating pendant white strokes and pomegranates with red centres; red stroke on flank; on lower part of tail, six knots or baubles); rider has long hair, short chiton with decorated top and holds reins in raised right hand and probably a goad in his left); on the right a small figure (possibly a child or eidolon, wearing red cap and short garment once either red or white) in mid-air to left; dancer to left, looking back (left arm and left lower leg lost; perhaps wearing phorbeia; red ‘loincloth’ with white band above waist; red dots on calf muscles). Hard fired, dense brown-grey clay with moderate amounts of small mica and some medium-sized lime inclusions (Munsell 5YE 6/4).
Curator's comments: Joins 1965,0428.1. Probably also belongs with 1888.6-1.552 and 1888.6-1.560 which preserves the foot and part of the wall. Analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen (cf. Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006), sample Nauk 76, Group B.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.54, p.56, p.57 fig.4, Table 1)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 55) (Labelled 1888.6-1.551)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.811)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 87-8, Nau 28, pl. 7a-b)
